keyword: how many calories in a fried chicken breast
title: How Many Calories in a Fried Chicken Breast?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a fried chicken breast, including full nutrition breakdown, protein, fat, carbs, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in a Fried Chicken Breast?
assumptions: Boneless, skinless chicken breast (~140 g raw weight), lightly breaded, deep-fried in vegetable oil; no added sauce or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by breading type, oil used, frying time, portion size, and brand; check labels or recipes for precision.

quick_answer.text: A typical fried chicken breast contains about 350 kcal and 28 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

faqs.q: How many calories in a fried chicken breast?
faqs.a: Approximately 350 kcal for one standard breaded and fried chicken breast.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a fried chicken breast?
faqs.a: About 28 g of protein per serving.

faqs.q: Does frying add a lot of fat to chicken breast?
faqs.a: Yes, around 20 g total fat, mostly from breading and oil absorption.

faqs.q: How do calories compare to grilled chicken breast?
faqs.a: Fried is higher (~350 kcal) vs. grilled (~165 kcal per similar size) due to breading and oil.

faqs.q: Is sodium high in fried chicken breast?
faqs.a: Yes, about 650 mg, often from breading or seasoning; opt for low-sodium versions.
